name: Paul Kagame
shortBio: President of Rwanda since 2000, known for Rwanda's economic transformation and recovery post-genocide
longBio: Paul Kagame is the President of Rwanda, widely recognized for his leadership in transforming Rwanda post-genocide. He is known for his efforts in rebuilding the country's economy and ensuring social stability.
achievements: Led the post-genocide recovery in Rwanda.
Initiated the Vision 2020 program to transform Rwanda's economy.

name: Abiy Ahmed Ali
shortBio: Prime Minister of Ethiopia, awarded the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize for ending the Eritrean border conflict
longBio: Abiy Ahmed Ali, Prime Minister of Ethiopia, was awarded the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize for his role in ending the Eritrean-Ethiopian conflict. His reforms aim to modernize the Ethiopian economy and society.
achievements: Initiated economic and political reforms in Ethiopia.

name: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala
shortBio: Director-General of the WTO and former Nigerian finance minister, known for her economic expertise
longBio: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is the Director-General of the World Trade Organization and a former Nigerian finance minister. Known for her economic expertise, she is a strong advocate for global economic reform.
achievements: First female and first African Director-General of the WTO.
Led Nigeria’s economic recovery efforts as Finance Minister.

name: Cyril Ramaphosa
shortBio: President of South Africa since 2018, former anti-apartheid activist, and businessman focused on economic growth.

name: Amina Mohammed
shortBio: Deputy President of Kenya, former Cabinet Secretary for Foreign Affairs, and international advocate for climate and trade.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
shortBio: President of Nigeria since 2015, focused on anti-corruption, security, and economic reforms

name: Goodluck Jonathan
shortBio: Former President of Nigeria, known for democratic reforms and infrastructure development.

name: Uhuru Kenyatta
shortBio: Former President of Kenya, focused on infrastructure, economic growth, and regional security.

name: Bola Tinubu
shortBio: President-elect of Nigeria, former Lagos State governor, and political kingmaker.

name: Raila Odinga
shortBio: Opposition leader and former Prime Minister of Kenya, advocate for democracy and social reforms.

name: Aisha Buhari
shortBio: First Lady of Nigeria, active in women's empowerment, youth development, and healthcare.

name: Rochas Okorocha
shortBio: Nigerian senator, former governor of Imo State, and education advocate.

name: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
shortBio: Renowned Nigerian author and advocate for gender equality and social justice.

name: Senator Florence Ita-Giwa
shortBio: Former senator from Cross River State, focused on women’s welfare and healthcare development.

name: Martha Karua
shortBio: Former Minister of Justice and deputy president candidate in Kenya, known for anti-corruption and human rights advocacy.
